project.description: This job check every 10 minutes the Repository and create a new TAG by incrementing the last TAG in the following branches: “3.0.0.GA”, “3.0.0_450HD”, “3.0.1”, 3.0.2”, “3.0.4” and "3.0.6"

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#git config --global user.name "Jenkins" #git config --global user.email devops@audiocodes.com
function createTag { if git log --pretty=format:%B -n1 $LastSha1 | grep "DevOps admin change"; then return fi if [[ $GERRIT_BRANCH =~ "feature" ]]; then # Check feature branch if it is the first TAG for this feature branch extName=$(echo $GERRIT_BRANCH | awk -F/ '{print $NF}' | cut -c1-3) extNameLong=$(echo $GERRIT_BRANCH | awk -F/ '{print $NF}' | cut -c1-6) if [[ ! $(echo $LastTag | cut -d. -f5-) =~ "$extName" ]]; then # In case the found TAG is already long like "3.2.0.241.med.53", change it to "3.2.0.241" if [[ $(echo $LastTag | awk -F. '{ print NF - 1 }') > 3 ]]; then LastTag=$LastMergedTag; fi # It is the first TAG so add 3 characters from the branch name and add it to the last current TAG # Start with number 1 (0 will chnage to 1), in case it is exist add 6 characters if git rev-parse $LastTag.$extName.1 >/dev/null 2>&1; then extName=$extNameLong; fi LastTag=$LastTag.$extName.0 fi fi NEWTAG=`echo $LastTag | sed -r 's/(.*)\.[^\d]+$/\1/'`.`echo $LastTag | awk -F. '{print $NF+1}'` if [[ $GERRIT_BRANCH =~ "feature" ]]; then if git rev-parse $NEWTAG >/dev/null 2>&1; then NEWTAG=$(echo $NEWTAG | sed s:$extName:$extNameLong:); fi fi git tag -a -m "Jenkins auto tag after $LastUser commit" $NEWTAG $LastSha1 git push origin $NEWTAG LastTag=$NEWTAG }
for GERRIT_BRANCH in 3.0.1 3.0.4.GA 3.0.40 3.0.0_450HD 3.1.0 3.2 feature/EMS_Client $(git branch --list -a */feature/3.* | sed 's:.*/origin/::') do echo Check branch $GERRIT_BRANCH if exist a new commit after the last TAG... if ! git describe --tags --first-parent origin/$GERRIT_BRANCH | grep -q -; then continue; fi git checkout origin/$GERRIT_BRANCH echo Find the last TAG name...
LastTag=`git tag --points-at $(git rev-list -n1 $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 --first-parent origin/$GERRIT_BRANCH)) --sort=-taggerdate | head -1` RealLastTag=$LastTag if [[ $GERRIT_BRANCH =~ "feature" ]]; then # Find the merged commit TAG (option '--merges') # the feature branches should start with it, # for example: 3.2.0.445.HTT.1 was merged from 3.2.0.445 LastMergedTag=`git tag --points-at $(git log --merges -n1 --pretty=format:%H)^2 --sort=-taggerdate 2>/dev/null | head -1 | cut -d. -f1-4 || echo Too old` echo LastTag = $LastTag ------------- LastMergedTag = $LastMergedTag # The last merged TAG must be with 3 periods kike: 3.2.0.445 this TAG came from the merged branch if [[ ! "$LastTag" =~ "$LastMergedTag" ]]; then LastTag=$LastMergedTag; echo set to $LastMergedTag; else LastTag=`git tag --points-at $(git rev-list -n1 $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0 origin/$GERRIT_BRANCH)) --sort=-taggerdate | head -1` fi fi LastUser="" while IFS=_ read -r Sha1 User When do if [ "$LastUser" != "" ] && [ "$LastUser" != "$User" ]; then createTag; fi LastUser=$User LastSha1=$Sha1 LastWhen=`echo $When | cut -d" " -f1` done <<< "$(git log --first-parent --reverse --date=raw --pretty=format:"%H_%cn_%cd" $RealLastTag..origin/$GERRIT_BRANCH)"
if [ -z $LastWhen ]; then continue; fi
echo Check the last commit if 5 minutes passed... CurrentTime=`date +%s` if [ `expr $CurrentTime - $LastWhen` -gt 300 ]; then createTag else echo Try again later after 300 seconds exit 2 fi done
